data.title: SF Studios on LinkedIn: Molly Hammar sings the theme song for SF Studios' disaster film The Abyss
data.meta_description: We are happy to share that Swedish singer Molly Hammar will create and sing the theme songÂ Deep DownÂ for our upcoming Swedish feature filmÂ The Abyss, that willâ€¦
data.text:
Are you passionate about law and have always dreamed of working within the film and TV industry? If so, we may have the perfect job for you! ğŸ¿ ğŸ¬ Read more and apply here: https://lnkd.in/dXkTcTtD

SF Studios is proud to announce our distribution title â€”Kalevala: The Story of Kullervo. The film, directed by Antti J. Jokinen, will bring the Finnish national epic to cinemas for the first time. Set to begin filming in September, this project represents a unique blend of mythology, history, and storytelling. The film will feature a stellar lineup of Finnish talent, including Elias Salonen and Jussi-award winner Eero Aho. The film is produced by ReelMedia Oy and REinvent handles international sales.

We are thrilled to announce that Pretty Young Love (SMUKKERE), the highly anticipated sequel to the acclaimed Danish film Pretty Young Thing (SMUK), has begun principal shooting. Produced by Marcella Dichmann and directed by Mogens Hagedorn, this new installment continues the story at Rosenholm Gymnasium with Selma navigating an unexpected romance with her new music teacher. The original film, released in 2022, achieved over 100,000 admissions in Denmark and won multiple awards, resonating deeply with audiences. We look forward to its summer 2025 premiere and expanding the beloved universe of Pretty Young Thing. Stay tuned! Read more here:

We're excited to announce that "Quisling - The Final Days" will have its international premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival in early September! Directed by Erik Poppe and produced by our Norwegian company Paradox, the film is also set to open the Norwegian International Film Festival in Haugesund before its theatrical release on September 13. Distribution in the Nordics will be handled by SF Studios, while REinvent manages international sales.
